awd_titl_txt: Joint U.S.-Venezuelan Workshop on High Performance Computing; January 3-7, 2000, Puerto La Cruz, Anzoategui, Venezuela
awd_abstract_narration:
9979307
Miller

This Americas Program award will support travel and related expenses for eight senior researchers and one junior faculty member, to participate in a joint US-Venezuela Workshop on High Performance Computing (HPC).  Organizers are Dr. Barton P. Miller, University of Wisconsin, Madison, and Dr. Carlos Figueira, Universidad Simon Bolivar, Caracas, Venezuela.  The topic area of this workshop, which explores the issues of delivering high levels of computing and data access, is a crucial one for coming decades, both technologically and economically. 

Workshop participants represent leaders in the areas of distributed supercomputing, high throughput computing, on-demand computing, data-intensive computing, and collaborative computing, all of which will be covered in the workshop.  The area of distributed (geographically dispersed) computing makes HPC especially well suited for international collaborations. The workshop will expand the domain of HPC problems and results available to the US researchers, and will lay the foundation for exchange and visits for faculty, graduate students and postdocs, from both countries.

***
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
